metadata.title: Convert Price to VAT – Financial Converter
metadata.description: Calculate VAT from a net or gross price with editable rates, dual outputs, and audit-friendly guidance aligned to EU and UK rules.

fields.label: Net price (before VAT)
fields.helpText: Enter the net amount; negatives are blocked to keep calculations valid.

fields.label: VAT rate (%)
fields.helpText: Use the applicable rate (e.g., 20% UK standard, 21% Ireland, 19% Germany, 10% reduced in some EU states).

introduction: Convert a net price to VAT and gross in one step so invoices, receipts, and quotes stay consistent with your jurisdiction’s rates.
Editable VAT rate covers standard and reduced bands across the EU and UK, while keeping the calculator lean for quick checks.
Both VAT amount and gross price appear together to align finance, procurement, and compliance teams.
methodology: VAT = net price × (rate/100); gross = net + VAT. This mirrors EU VAT Directive 2006/112/EC and HMRC guidance for forward calculations.
Inputs are unit-agnostic (currency) and we apply no hidden rounding; round per your invoicing rules.
Document the VAT rate, jurisdiction, and rounding applied (e.g., HMRC VAT Notice 700 or local EU guidance) for audit trails.

faqs.question: Which VAT rate should I enter?
faqs.answer: Use the rate on the invoice (standard or reduced). Examples: 20% UK standard, 21% Ireland, 19% Germany, 10% reduced in many EU countries.

faqs.question: How should I round the results?
faqs.answer: Round per your jurisdiction’s invoicing rules (e.g., to the nearest cent/penny). The calculator keeps full precision until display.

faqs.question: Can I handle exempt or zero-rated items?
faqs.answer: Yes. Set the rate to 0% to show VAT 0 and gross = net.

faqs.question: Is this acceptable for audits?
faqs.answer: Yes—record the rate, jurisdiction, and rounding. Cite HMRC VAT Notice 700 or your local EU guidance when filing.

summary: Forward-calculates VAT and gross from a net price using rate/100 for compliance alignment.
Keeps rate editable to cover standard and reduced bands; outputs VAT and gross together for audits.
Citations to EU and UK VAT rules reinforce accuracy and filing readiness.

glossary.definition: Tax calculated by multiplying net price by the VAT rate.
Percentage applied to the net price to compute VAT; varies by jurisdiction and product category.
